verses.plain: I will extol thee, O LORD; for thou hast lifted me up, and hast not made my foes to rejoice over me.

tokens.t: ; for thou hast lifted me up, and hast not made my foes to rejoice over me.

verses.plain: O LORD my God, I cried unto thee, and thou hast healed me.

tokens.t: my God, I cried unto thee, and thou hast healed me.

verses.plain: O LORD, thou hast brought up my soul from the grave: thou hast kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.

tokens.t: , thou hast brought up my soul from the grave: thou hast kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.

verses.plain: Sing unto the LORD, O ye saints of his, and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.

tokens.t: , O ye saints of his, and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.

verses.plain: For his anger endureth but a moment; in his favour is life: weeping may endure for a night, but joy cometh in the morning.

tokens.t: life: weeping may endure for a night, but joy

verses.plain: And in my prosperity I said, I shall never be moved.

tokens.t: And in my prosperity I said, I shall never be moved.

verses.plain: LORD, by thy favour thou hast made my mountain to stand strong: thou didst hide thy face, and I was troubled.

tokens.t: , by thy favour thou hast made my mountain to stand strong: thou didst hide thy face,

verses.plain: I cried to thee, O LORD; and unto the LORD I made supplication.
What profit is there in my blood, when I go down to the pit? Shall the dust praise thee? shall it declare thy truth?

tokens.t: in my blood, when I go down to the pit? Shall the dust praise thee? shall it declare thy truth?

verses.plain: Hear, O LORD, and have mercy upon me: LORD, be thou my helper.
Thou hast turned for me my mourning into dancing: thou hast put off my sackcloth, and girded me with gladness;

tokens.t: Thou hast turned for me my mourning into dancing: thou hast put off my sackcloth, and girded me with gladness;

verses.plain: To the end that my glory may sing praise to thee, and not be silent. O LORD my God, I will give thanks unto thee for ever.

tokens.t: glory may sing praise to thee, and not be silent. O
my God, I will give thanks unto thee for ever.

footnotes.text: his anger…: Heb. there is but a moment in his anger
for a night: Heb. in the evening
made…: Heb. settled strength for my mountain
my glory: that is, my tongue, or, my soul
